About Me

I am a data scientist with 10+ years of experience in Python, data analysis, and mathematical modeling. Currently, I work building predictive models for 6sense. Prior to this I was a number of things: Fellow in the Insight Data Science program, science teacher at Astrocamp, and physicist at the University of Wisconsin.

I am also an avid amateur adventurer in the outdoors and have been developing a growing interest in painting and photography, all of which I post about on Instagram.

Research

My PhD work was focused on the characterization of instabilities in a magnetically confined plasma and the turbulence that arises as a result. In particular, my work was concerned with the reversed field pinch, a magnetic confinement fusion concept device. A copy of my thesis can be downloaded here.

This site is built using Jekyll and the Moon template.
